pros: Good benefits, company growing but still gives close attention to individual employees.
cons: Some resources being stretched can be hard on the employees.

job_title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: Great benefits, good environment, decent pay
cons: trainer did not spend enough time with me and I failed at the job due to that

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Bullhead City, AZ
pros: Great phlebotomist, medical assistant and manager
cons: Too many to share. Unsupportive upper management, no training, minimal support

pros: Stable work, good working environment, good benefits.
cons: No raises, conditions of your particular clinic vary from the main office.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Winslow, AZ
pros: My peers and direct supervisors are great to work for, they listen.
cons: Regional Management, there is no grey only black and white. Quick to judge, micromanage.

job_title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: Good benefit options and room to grow in the company.
cons: Pay could be better and it is hard and rare to get a raise unless you move to a higher position.

pros: Culture, benefits, flexibility, mentorship, growth opportunities
cons: Love working here, wish the salary could be higher

pros: Positive work environment for the most part.
cons: Fluctuating hours. Also a pro though. Not full time.

pros: Doctors are amazing and caring
cons: Pay is not competitive enough

pros: Great team environment, people passionate about providing healthcare to uninsured patients
cons: Working at north country you will have a Lower salary than average

review_title: Great People Serving Those in Need
pros: The people. Great relationships built while working toward a common goal.
cons: Non-profit so pay is on lower end. But that is to be expected

review_title: Fairly good place to work, typical healthcare office environment, helping people was great.
job_title: Spanish Interpreter in Show Low, AZ
pros: I felt like I really helped contribute to patient health outcomes, that was nice. Many individuals were grateful for my assistance, I felt appreciated by the patients.
cons: The typical office interactions you will find anywhere I think, it wasn't too bad.

review_title: One of the most advanced employers for clinical pharmacists
job_title: Ambulatory Clinical Pharmacist in Kingman, AZ
pros: Clinical pharmacist have a lot of freedom to practice, and have CPAs to further increase their scope. Being in an FQHC provides a lot of benefits in making sure patients get the treatment that you, the pharmacist, want.
cons: Clinical team is small and does not have as much experience as some other health care systems.

pros: Staff like family, good work-life balance,
cons: Pay is terrible, management doesn't care about or respect their employees, HR is a joke

pros: good place to work and learn
cons: lack of communication for some employees

pros: Generous PTO & Sick Time
cons: Politics, small clinic, small town politics effect patient care. Nurses have big egos and treat front staff with no respect. Clinical supervisor has been there for over 20 years and checks on front staff on Saturday & Sundays on her days OFF! Providers are burnt out and complain non-stop about patients & the company on general. Negative work environment in general. Have went through 3 clinical managers in less than TWO years. The insurance is unaffordable because this is federally funded operation. Must work here 12 months to be paid out PTO.

review_title: Okay employer but I'm not completely happy
pros: They do have pretty good benefits and their HR team does try to engage employees.  For the most part the people who work here seem to genuinely care about their jobs and the field they work in. The pay is decent.
cons: Office politics.  They implemented a pay matrix recently that I got the short end of the stick on, and in my current position there is almost no upward mobility opportunities.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: The ability to provide care to vulnerable populations. Connecting with patients in the community. Flexibility in work schedule.
cons: Was asked many times to work outside of my scope of practice. Supervisor unaware of how the department actually functions. Minimal and ineffective training. The providers are extremely overworked. Ineffective management. HR ineffective with complaints.  Screaming an acceptable behavior. Policies and procedures (if they exist) are not enforced. Too little oversight.

review_title: Growing Opportunities in Rural Health Care
pros: opportunity to serve the comminity.  the encouragement to participate on multiple levels of healthcare within the corporation.  Fair salary and benefits.
cons: Intense workload, even without hospital duties, work weeks can be 60+ hours.  Providers in rural satalites can feel isolated from the main office.

pros: Flexible scheduling, fair pay, useful leadership and supervisory training from HR
cons: No support from HR for conflict resolution. Lots of in office politics. Micro-management. High turn around rate. No opportunity for growth or career advancement.

review_title: Company hiding under Green Country Health Care
pros: Management recognizes its reputation is so terrible its posting jobs under a different name.
cons: Staff rude and disrespectful to clients. Horrible place to try to work. Waste of time
